As a New Zealander, I am well accustomed to the local colloquial language that is used in day to day speech. However, I do not profusely use it in fear of desecrating my somewhat nominal English. However, in the face of a crash course Engineering Course, I shall use slang.

Hence: "How's it going mate, I'm gonna grab up the cuzzies, bloody get on the bush, then get we gonna get ourselves some chippies to curb the munchies and while doing this we are gonna be watching crash course engineering without getting knackered.

Translation: Hello there friend, let's go grab some friends, retire some place, get some Potato crisps to curb our hunger and whild doing this we are going to be watching Crash Course Engineering without getting tired at all.

"Over the next 46 episodes, we're going to get a feel" ... Gonna be hard simply getting a feel with only 46 episodes. Engineering includes calculus, it includes problem-solving, it includes innovation and A LOT of work. I fear this will lead a lot of people astray, but I'm looking forward to learning a bit more about engineering disciplines other than electrical. Also, be sure to hit of systems engineering(how things you learn in one engineering discipline are almost the same as in other engineering disciplines). That's probably the most important of all and probably the easiest route to take in teaching ALL the disciplines.

I also think you're doing a good job of not overloading people with information in this preview.
